author: Steven T. Dennis
description: Senators in both parties are working to quickly revive stablecoin legislation backed by the crypto industry that faltered after a furor over President Donald Trump’s growing portfolio of lucrative crypto ventures.
title: Crypto-Backed Stablecoin Bill Gets Bipartisan Push for Quick Revival in Senate

author: Henrique Almeida
description: Portugal’s far-right leader Andre Ventura was helped off the stage during a speech at a campaign dinner on Tuesday, sparking concerns about his health before a snap election due to take place on Sunday.
title: Portugal Far-Right Leader Helped Off Stage After Feeling Unwell

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: Qatar’s offer of a luxury Boeing 747 to President Donald Trump has set off alarm bells within the US intelligence and diplomatic community, where gifts from foreign powers have long been viewed with suspicion.
title: Trump’s Freebie Qatar Jet Is the Stuff of Nightmares in Spyworld

author: Samy Adghirni
description: French President Emmanuel Macron urged the European Union to step up pressure on Israel over the humanitarian situation in Gaza.
title: Macron Calls for More Pressure on Israel Over Gaza Actions

author: David Voreacos, Janet Lorin
description: Harvard University expanded its lawsuit Tuesday against the Trump administration for freezing billions of dollars in federal funds, ratcheting up the high-stakes legal battle between the wealthiest US university and the White House.
title: Harvard Expands Lawsuit Against US as Trump Funding Feud Deepens

author: Eric Martin
description: President Donald Trump sent a message to the world in Saudi Arabia: make business deals and the US won’t meddle in your affairs.
title: Trump Puts Dealmaking Over Rights in Saudi Arabia Policy Speech

author: Jarrell Dillard
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, US economy reporter Jarrell Dillard looks at the headwinds still facing the economy. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Trade War Still Weighing on Economy as Recession Risk Fades

author: Zach C Cohen
description: For as long as Americans have paid federal income taxes, they’ve been able to subtract some of what they pay to their state and local governments from their taxable income. This federal deduction for state and local taxes — the SALT deduction, for short — has a big influence on how the tax burden is divided. It tends to help taxpayers in wealthier, more urban states, where sales taxes are higher and real estate costs more. President Donald Trump’s first-term tax law, approved in 2017, capped the
title: How the SALT Fight Threatens to Derail the Republican Tax Bill

author: Chris Anstey
description: Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers applauded the Trump administration’s walk-back from what he characterized as overly aggressive trade protection measures, singling out Scott Bessent in particular for his weekend work with China.
title: Summers Salutes Bessent on China Deal, Says US Retreat Pragmatic

author: Marcelo Rochabrun
description: Peru’s unpopular President Dina Boluarte surprisingly replaced her finance minister who had been on the job less than four months.
title: Peru Surprisingly Changes Finance Minister Ahead of PM Censure Vote

author: Ken Parks
description: Jose “Pepe” Mujica, the former left-wing guerrilla who spent more than a decade in prison before becoming president of Uruguay and making it the first country in the world to legalize cannabis, has died. He was 89.
title: Jose Mujica, Guerrilla Who Became Uruguay President, Dies at 89

author: Lynn Doan
description: The Commerce Department issued guidance stating that the use of Huawei Technologies Co.’s Ascend artificial intelligence chips “anywhere in the world” violates the government’s export controls, escalating US efforts to curb technological advances in China.
title: US Warns That Using Huawei AI Chip ‘Anywhere’ Breaks Its Rules

author: Alicia Diaz
description: House Republicans have proposed using their giant tax and spending bill to end duty-free imports of cheap foreign goods, a move that would eliminate a perk companies around the world have used to grow their US business for the last decade.
title: GOP Tax Bill to End Duty-Free Imports of Cheap Foreign Goods

author: Volodymyr Verbianyi
description: Ukraine and the US have signed additional agreements concerning a natural resources deal, a key demand of US President Donald Trump which is crucial for sustaining military aid for Kyiv.
title: Ukraine, US Sign Additional Documents on Implementing Minerals Deal

author: Michelle Kaske
description: A long-awaited House bill could dull the allure of municipal bonds in some states by tripling the federal deduction limit to $30,000, even as the legislation looks to keep the securities tax exempt.
title: SALT Cap Hike Risks Denting Muni Appeal in New York, California

author: Konrad Krasuski
description: Romanian ultranationalist George Simion attended the election rally of Poland’s opposition candidate Karol Nawrocki five days before the presidential vote in both countries.
title: Romania’s Ultranationalist Endorses Poland’s Nawrocki

author: Misha Savic
description: Serbian authorities detained a former state official over allegedly forging paperwork to smooth the way for Jared Kushner’s firm to build a luxury hotel and residences in the Balkan country’s capital.
title: Serbia Detains Ex-Official for Alleged Forgery for Trump Hotel

author: Josh Wingrove, Augusta Saraiva
description: President Donald Trump cited a softer-than-expected inflation report to again pressure Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell to lower interest rates.
title: Trump Says Fed Must Lower Rates After Soft Inflation Report

author: Ryan Chua, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said Secretary of State Marco Rubio and other US officials will go to Istanbul later this week for potential talks between the Russian and Ukrainian leaders, even if there’s still no certainty that Vladimir Putin will show up.
title: Trump Says Rubio Heading to Istanbul for Ukraine-Russia Talks

author: Paula Sambo, Christine Dobby
description: The first time Timothy Hodgson was asked by Mark Carney to come to Ottawa, he left behind an investment banking career at Goldman Sachs Group Inc. that had seen him climb the ranks to lead its Canadian business.
title: ‘Bulldog’ Ex-Goldman Banker Answers Carney’s Call to Fix Canada Resources Sector

author: Malathi Nayak
description: Twenty states sued the US Homeland Security Department on Tuesday, claiming the Trump administration illegally conditioned billions of dollars in federal funding on immigration enforcement.
title: California, New York Sue US to Avoid Grant Cuts Over Immigration

author: Oscar Medina
description: Colombia’s business lobby warned of risks to local industry from President Gustavo Petro’s plan to join the Chinese Belt and Road Initiative.
title: Colombian Business Lobby Warns of Risks From a Deal With China

author: Sam Dagher
description: When US President Donald Trump touched down in Riyadh he was greeted by a Saudi leader who was in every respect a king — except for his official title.
title: Saudi King-in-Waiting Marks Ascent With Gilded Welcome for Trump

author: Paul Wallace
description: Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman said the kingdom will boost investments in the US to $1 trillion.
title: Saudi Arabia’s MBS Says Will Boost US Investments to $1 Trillion

author: Paul Wallace
description: US President Donald Trump will briefly meet Syria’s new leader, Ahmed al-Sharaa, in Saudi Arabia in Wednesday, according to a White House official.
title: Trump to Meet Syrian President in Saudi Arabia, US Official Says

author: Ryan Chua
description: The US took a fresh step seeking to curb Iran’s oil revenues with sanctions on an international network that it said facilitates the shipment of millions of barrels to China, an effort by the Trump administration to further pressure Tehran while negotiating over its nuclear program.
title: US Slaps Sanctions on Network Shipping Iranian Oil to China

author: Brian Platt, Mathieu Dion
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney unveiled his new economic team, keeping longtime politician François-Philippe Champagne as finance minister and placing former Goldman Sachs banker Timothy Hodgson in charge of energy and mining.
title: Carney Stacks Cabinet With Ex-Goldman Banker

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy reinforced his intention to hold direct talks with Vladimir Putin in Turkey on Thursday, even as the Russian leader offered no clarity on whether he’d show up.
title: Zelenskiy Stands by Plan to Meet Putin in Turkey for Talks

author: Greg Sullivan
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin hailed the recruitment of volunteers to fight in his war in Ukraine, suggesting the pace of efforts to replenish the ranks has significantly increased since last year.
title: Putin Hails Ramped Up Military Recruiting for War in Ukraine

author: Slav Okov
description: Bulgaria’s parliament speaker dismissed an initiative by President Rumen Radev to hold a referendum on euro adoption as the nation moves closer to joining the single currency next year.
title: Bulgarian President’s Proposal for Euro Referendum Blocked

author: Alessandra Migliaccio, Jorge Valero, Kamil Kowalcze
description: Polish Finance Minister Andrzej Domanski said he expects the European Union to reach a deal this month on a €150 billion ($167 billion) fund to boost the bloc’s defense capabilities.
title: Poland’s Domanski Sees EU Defense Fund Agreement This Month

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Hadriana Lowenkron, Kate Sullivan
description: US President Donald Trump has secured $600 billion in investment commitments during a summit in Saudi Arabia aimed at securing new deals, according to the White House, a key focus of his first scheduled foreign trip since returning to office.
title: US Says It Secured $600 Billion in Investments From Saudi Arabia

author: Akayla Gardner
description: President Donald Trump’s administration is cutting another $450 million in grants to Harvard University, the latest escalation in a fight that has seen US officials seek to exert control over the oldest and richest US school.
title: Harvard Hit by Extra $450 Million Funding Cut Over Antisemitism

author: Mpho Hlakudi
description: Investor demand at South Africa’s weekly government bond sale more than doubled as risk appetite improved globally after the US and China reached a deal to temporarily lower tariffs.
title: Demand Soars at South Africa Bond Sale as Risk Mood Lifts

author: Dan Williams
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he’s days away from ordering an all-out escalation of Israel’s war against Hamas, and even the release of more hostages would only pause the campaign to destroy the Iran-backed group.
title: Israel’s Netanyahu Vows to ‘Finish the Job’ of Destroying Hamas

author: Catherine Lucey
description: Global AI, a US tech firm, plans to collaborate with a Saudi Arabian artificial intelligence venture, Humain, in an agreement expected to be worth billions of dollars, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: US Firm Global AI Secures Saudi Investment Worth Billions

author: Nicolle Yapur
description: The surprise exit of a group of political opposition members from Caracas has brought new life to the beleaguered market for Venezuela’s defaulted bonds.
title: Venezuela Bond Market Gets Lift From Freeing of Political Aides

author: Sanne Wass
description: NATO must take a stronger role in the Arctic to deter increasing Russian activity, according to the alliance’s former secretary general.
title: NATO’s Former Head Says Allies Must Counter Russia’s Arctic Rise

author: Katia Dmitrieva
description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and other major banks boosted their growth forecasts for China’s economy, citing a temporary deal with the US to de-escalate their trade conflict.
title: Goldman, JPMorgan Lift China Growth Outlook on US Tariff Truce

author: Julian Lee
description: Earnings from crude shipments remain near two-year low despite uptick in flows
title: Russian Oil Exports’ Value Crimped Again by Latest Price Slide

author: Jorge Valero, Andrea Palasciano
description: The European Union is discussing ways to prevent Hungary from undermining the opening of accession talks with Ukraine, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Seeks to Stop Hungary Blocking Ukraine’s Membership Talks

author: Salma El Wardany, Tarek El-Tablawy
description: Egypt cut fees for some vessels crossing the Suez Canal, seeking to spur a revival of the key global trade route after Donald Trump’s deal to halt Yemeni militant attacks on Red Sea shipping.
title: Egypt Cuts Canal Fees to Attract Shipping Amid Trump-Houthi Deal

author: Jennifer Zabasajja, Kamailoudini Tagba, Ekow Dontoh
description: Ghana is encouraging investors to get the country’s crude out of the ground to avoid the assets from getting stranded amid a global decarbonization push.
title: Ghana’s Mahama Fine Tuning Regime to Accelerate Crude Extraction

author: Tom Orlik
description: Monetary policy is too technical to be left to the politicians and too political to be left to the technocrats.
title: The Problem With the Fed Isn’t Independence, It’s Accountability

author: Josh Xiao, Yian Lee
description: The recent conflict between India and Pakistan is prompting a reassessment of Chinese weapons, challenging long-held perceptions of their inferiority to Western arms and sparking concern in places wary of Beijing.
title: Chinese Weapons Gain Credibility After Pakistan-India Conflict

author: Travis Waldron
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Lula’s China Trip Channels Xi’s Trade Defiance

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: Two liberal Philippine politicians have emerged as key players after a surprisingly strong performance in Senate elections, gaining support from a bloc of voters dissatisfied with rancor between President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. and his deputy Sara Duterte.
title: Marcos-Duterte Feud Spurs Surprise Gains by ‘Third Force’ in Philippine Vote

author: Nancy Cook
description: Republicans injected some populist elements to their latest draft plan for Donald Trump’s tax cuts, while stopping short of embracing a progressive move the president recently endorsed and failing to silence critics that it ultimately puts the rich ahead.
title: GOP Tax Plan Tilts to Trump Populism But Still Aids the Rich

author: Alex Wickham, Ania Nussbaum
description: King Charles III will host French President Emmanuel Macron for his first state visit to the UK in July, Buckingham Palace said.
title: King Charles to Host France’s Macron for First UK State Visit

author: Andra Timu
description: Romania’s presidential runoff is shaping up to be a tight contest between a far-right party leader poised to upend the Black Sea nation’s pro-European path and a contender promising a more centrist brand of leadership.
title: Romania Is Headed for Tight Presidential Runoff, Poll Shows

author: Alan Wong
description: Hong Kong fast-tracked changes to its national security laws that further consolidate Beijing’s control over the financial hub, with the new regulations taking effect immediately.
title: Hong Kong Rushes Security Law Changes, Cementing Beijing’s Grip

author: James Mayger, Weilun Soon
description: A China-US deal to slash trade tariffs is set to push freight rates higher, as companies rush to use a 90-day grace period to ferry goods across the Pacific Ocean.
title: China-US Truce Prompts Price Jump in Pacific Shipping Frenzy

author: Colum Murphy, Paul Abelsky
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the trade deal from Donald Trump’s first tariff war with China gives the world’s two biggest economies “a very good framework” for upcoming discussions after the temporary lifting of levies between them.
title: Bessent Is Upbeat on China Trade Talks Thanks to 2020 Framework

author: Joe Mayes, Lizzy Burden
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said she didn’t rule out mandating pension funds to allocate money to UK assets, as the government seeks to channel more investment into the domestic economy.
title: Reeves Says ‘Never Say Never’ on Mandating UK Pension Investment

author: Gresa Kraja
description: Albanian Prime Minister Edi Rama cemented his control over parliament at this weekend’s election as voters bought into his pledges to take the nation into the European Union by 2030.
title: Albanian Premier Boosts Parliament Control With Election Triumph

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand has submitted a range of proposals to the US on how it plans to boost imports and promote investments, the latest bid by the Southeast Asian nation to nudge the Trump administration to begin formal talks over a planned 36% tariff on exports.
title: Thailand Submits Proposals to US to Get Tariff Talks Started

author: Karin Matussek, Michael Nienaber
description: Hundreds of law-enforcement officers in seven German states raided sites linked to a far-right extremist movement after the interior ministry banned one of its largest groups.
title: Germany Bans Right-Wing Extremist Group in Crackdown

author: Joao Lima
description: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s AD coalition led the opposition Socialists by a margin of 6.9 percentage points in an opinion poll, TVI reported on its website.
title: Portuguese Prime Minister’s Coalition Leads in Poll, TVI Reports

author: Jordan Fabian
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent downplayed the possibility of a quick trade agreement with the European Union, saying the bloc suffers from a “collective action problem” that’s hampering negotiations.
title: Bessent Says EU May Have a ‘Collective Action Problem’ on Trade

author: Santosh Kumar, Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Dan Strumpf
description: Indian officials denied that trade with the US was used as a bargaining chip in a just-concluded ceasefire between India and Pakistan, contradicting statements by President Donald Trump that the US offered to trade more with both countries if they stopped hostilities.
title: India Denies Trump’s Suggestion He Used Trade to Secure Truce

description: President Donald Trump, left, and Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman at at King Khalid International Airport on May 13.
title: Trump Lands in Saudi Arabia to Start Middle East Trip

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: India has proposed levies on some US goods in response to Washington’s duties on steel and aluminum, marking its first retaliation against President Donald Trump’s tariff regime, even as the two countries move closer to finalizing a trade deal.
title: India Proposes First Counter Move Against Trump’s Tariff Regime

author: Danny Lee
description: China has removed a month-long ban on airlines taking delivery of Boeing Co. planes, according to people familiar with the matter, following a breakthrough in trade talks with the US that temporarily slashed tariffs on each side.
title: China Removes Ban on Boeing Deliveries After US Trade Truce

author: Philip Heijmans
description: The UN’s aviation council ruled on Monday that Russia was responsible for the 2014 downing of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 that killed all 298 passengers and crew, including more than 200 Dutch and Australian citizens.
title: UN Agency Rules Russia Shot Down Malaysian Passenger Jet in 2014

author: Matthew Martin, Zainab Fattah
description: US President Donald Trump’s hopes of securing as much as $1 trillion in investment commitments from Saudi Arabia might clash with another costly ambition - transforming the kingdom’s own economy.
title: Trump Faces $2 Trillion Hurdle to Win Money From Saudi Prince

author: Colum Murphy, Jing Li
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping vowed to deepen economic cooperation with Latin American and Caribbean nations and offered visa-free entry to some countries, as he seeks to position China as a better partner than the US.
title: Xi Courts Latin America as Trump’s Tariffs Pressure Region

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: The global trade war with its persistent barrage of tariff developments provides both challenges and opportunities, according to Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, the Director General of the World Trade Organisation.
title: Tariffs Create World Challenges, Opportunities, WTO Head Says

author: Ben Westcott
description: Australia’s center-right Liberal party has elected Sussan Ley as its new leader, the first woman to head the party since it was founded in 1944, taking up the task of leading the opposition back to government after a devastating election loss 10 days ago.
title: Australia’s Liberal Opposition Elects Ley as First Female Leader

author: Eric Martin
description: It was the kind of week that would make even a seasoned diplomat’s head spin: China trade talks, India-Pakistan truce, a ceasefire with the Houthis and Iran nuclear negotiations. Not to mention a Gaza hostage release, new trade framework with the UK and the tantalizing prospect of ending Russia’s war in Ukraine.
title: Trump’s Diplomatic Frenzy Spins Big Gambles as Signs of Success
